Job Description:
Front End Developer


We
have an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to join the CPL Team!

Who are CPL?

Over the last ten years, be it via desktop or mobile application, CPL has constantly delivered technologically advanced solutions for nearly two million users across hundreds of clients.

2020 brings a brand-new opportunity to work on our exciting new artificial intelligent (AI) driven engagement platform. Utilising the latest cloud based technology from Microsoft Azure, CPL will deliver game changing education solutions within the hospitality and retail sectors.

We are firm believers in the right tool for the job meaning we are not afraid to utilising cutting edge technology to improve our solutions.

What
will you do?

From taking ownership of cutting edge projects to collaborating with others to contribute towards the delivery of our 2020 product roadmap. You will be encouraged to bring ideas to the table to help create technical direction and improvements across the development team. You will be exposed to every area of the business, collaborating with our in house design, client and implementation teams.

The role will involve providing support to both junior team members via coding guidance or mentorship and our non-technical colleagues with simple and understandable explanations of the really (cool/clever) stuff you’ve done!

Due to our growing user base, the emphasis to produce clean and efficient code is a must, and those that thrive on shaving off milliseconds through out the box thinking is the ideal candidate.

Who's right for the role?

A driven personality with a real desire to learn and solve problems. Somebody that can talk the talk, but also leave the tech talk at the door and communicate effectively with those not in a technical role. An ability to work both proactively and reactively in a fast paced and demanding environment.

Requirements
Proven experience working as a software developer in a
commercial environment
Direct experience utilising ASP.Net, C#, MVC, CSS and
Modern Javascript Frameworks
Experience producing and consuming RESTFUL APIs
Extensive experience with web development and best
practices
Nice
to Have
Experience working with T-SQL and Entity Framework
Understanding of relational database design
The
Company

At
CPL, we know we have a pretty exceptional bunch of people. Our talented team
have joined us early in their careers, thriving upon the culture and office
vibe, and seizing the development opportunities available. Our people have
become directly involved in the creation of some exciting products, servicing
some big-name clients which has seen the Company grow from strength to
strength!

We
are looking for people to join us who are inventive, hardworking and team
players who in return will receive:
23 days’ annual leave, plus UK bank holidays
Flexible
core working hours
Medicash
healthcare scheme
Monthly
pizza Friday and fully stocked fizzy drinks fridges
Relaxed
dress code
Fantastic
Christmas and Spring staff parties
If
you want to be part of a friendly close knit team and with plenty of
opportunities to progress, then apply today!

Why Money Dashboard?
We’re building the best personal finance app in the world

We first launched in 2010, with a small team in Edinburgh, passionate about making the often-confusing world of personal finance more open, transparent and accessible for everyone.

Today our mission remains the same: to help people from every walk of life be happier and more successful by mastering their money. We’re on a mission to change millions of lives, and have made a strong start. And the best is yet to come.

Are you passionate about our mission? Do you want to be part of the next big fintech success story?


That’s where the team comes in
We hire the best people and let them get on with it

A strong belief in what we do is what gets us out of bed in the morning. We believe less in job titles and more in organising ourselves with a common goal to get things done.

We collaborate and seek input from others to do our best work
We are accountable for our own acts and omissions, celebrate our wins and look for ways to improve our work, our product and ourselves
We disrupt and we learn fast
We focus on creating a culture that works for everyone and seek people who will help us challenge our own assumptions


Here’s what our ideal Developer looks like:
You’re looking for more than just a paycheck. You share our vision of a more open and transparent financial landscape for all
You are a quick learner and keen to develop your skill set
You work well as part of a team
You have a proven track record of delivering at pace
You don’t wait to be told to do something
You’re excited by the potential of fintech


Sound like you? Here’s some of what you’ll be doing:
C#.NET (& Core)
Entity Framework
SQL Server (2014 / 2016), MySQL (5.8)
RESTful Web APIs and back-end implementation
AngularJS and other modern front-end frameworks (such as React)
Serverless / containers in .NET Core, Python, Node.Js
Working with cloud architectures & development (AWS), Serverless event driven architectures, Containers and Microservices
Design and implementation of software solutions using proven software engineering techniques
Implementing security best practices due to the sensitive nature of the data we handle


You’ll be in good company

You will be part of an established Technology team filled with high achievers. You will have an immediate impact and play a key role in taking Money Dashboard to the next level.


What we offer:
Competitive Salary
Pension Contributions
33 days of holidays plus a hot day on the rare occasion it gets hotter than 22 degrees in Edinburgh!
Fully flexible holidays (take the days whenever you want)
Perkbox - think cheap cinema tickets, free coffees and mobile phone insurance
The opportunity to learn, grow and progress your career
Conferences and Events so you can learn from tech’s brightest minds
Free food after 7pm for late workers
Extra day of holidays for each year of service
Cycle to work scheme
Equity based incentive package

If you're an experienced engineer with extensive knowledge about Frontend Web development, who also has a passion for building delightful user experiences, join us!

As an Angular / TypeScript Software Engineer at Granta, you will be responsible for building front end interfaces to our flagship Materials Information products, used in the Aerospace & Automotive sectors.

What you'll do:
• Implement compelling, usable web applications; contribute to their design; and engineer them with Angular & Typescript
• Develop clean, maintainable, reusable cross-browser code
• Champion the User Experience across our software development process
• Optimize our web applications for maximum speed and scalability
• Draft UI designs, and ensure their technical feasibility
• Join a fun team, make a difference, and grow your skills

What we're looking for:
• You're e xperienced in developing front end web applications in Angular / TypeScript, HTML and CSS
• You have an eye for design and visual aesthetics and attention to detail
• You know how to use design patterns to create simple and reusable components for complex UIs
• You possess strong communication skills and the ability to draft and visually communicate UI design
• You're self-driven, with a and conscientious mentality and a commitment to innovate with high- quality work.

Our culture & values

Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act; how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company. At ANSYS we care about;
• Customer focus
• Results and Accountability
• Innovation
• Transparency and Integrity
• Mastery
• Inclusiveness
• Sense of urgency
• Collaboration and Teamwork

ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

CULTURE AND VALUES

Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork
WORKING AT ANSYS

At ANSYS, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at ANSYS are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at ANSYS, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At ANSYS, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.

Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, ANSYS has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

ANSYS is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

THE ROLE
This role will be part of our front-end development team to redesign and build high quality user experiences for our digital marketplaces and SaaS solutions.
The right candidate will have an in-depth understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript development and deployment best practice. Experience of UX design is advantageous, as is a passion for coding and active involvement in the engineering community.
THE TECH STACK
HTML5/CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, React, .NET Core, SQL Server, MySQL, Redis, AWS, Azure, Docker, Git
KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
• At least 12 months front end development experience with HTML5/CSS3 and JavaScript
• A good eye for design and user experience
• Good knowledge and experience of building engaging front ends whilst minimising page load and render times
• Good knowledge and experience of modern web best practice, such as mobile first, responsive design and adaptive design
• Knowledge and experience of automated testing
• Knowledge and experience of invoking REST web services and APIs
• Knowledge and experience of UX Design
• Desirable to have some knowledge and experience of developing web apps with React
• Desirable to have some knowledge and experience of .NET web development
• Some knowledge and experience of task runners, CI pipelines and DevOps methods
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
• Active involvement in the design and development of the marketplace and SaaS front-ends
• Work collaboratively in a team of agile engineers
• Help foster an agile engineering culture
• Adopt good engineering patterns and practices
• Collaborate with product managers and internal stakeholders to define requirements and plans
• Compile and maintain good quality documentation
• Work collaboratively with external development partners to ensure code quality is maintained
• Technical due diligence of third-party integrations
• Provide developer support to the DevOps and Customer Services teams
• Keep abreast of the latest developments in technology

Digital Web Developer European Head Office, Crewe About Assurant: One of the biggest businesses youve probably never heard of has some very big opportunities for people with big ambition. We are Assurant. An innovative Fortune 500 company with 15,000 colleagues around the world, who protect what matters most to over 300 million customers. And whether its automotive support, mobile phone and gadget protection or house and business rental insurance, we are always ready to make sure small problems dont become big issues. The opportunity: Our continued significant year on year growth means opportunity for everyone, following the merger of Assurant and The Warranty Group in May 2018, we need a range of IT professionals who can harness the power of technology to develop the insights, the products and the strategies that will excite our customers, bring our people together and take our business forward. Based in our European HQ in Crewe, every role will help us meet our growth targets and continue to expand our customer base. About you: Youll be working with a team of very like-minded colleagues; youll be a decision maker and problem solver. And with access to senior leaders, your career opportunities will grow as you do. Most importantly youll be at the start of an ambitious growth period for Assurant across our European businesses. You might be part of a smaller business looking to step-up to the next level. Or, you might be part of a large organisation, but are looking for the next challenge. Whatever your background, this opportunity will help build all our futures. Role specifics: This role is responsible for collaborating with the global solutions design and test functions and chosen third party partners to deliver digital solutions, ensuring quality, performance and regulatory standards are met. This role is based Crewe, UK as a member of the digital development team. Other responsibilities include, but are not limited to ; Creates low-level design, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderately complex programs and scripts from agreed specifications and subsequent iterations, using agreed standards and tools Contribute to the implementation of long term strategic vision of the team and technologies, responding to the flexible demands of the working environment Collaborates with others as appropriate during delivery and subsequent support of project delivery. Build strong working relationships with other developers, and teams throughout IT & Business Change Interprets standards to meet project needs and produces web solutions as required Provide unit tests of own work and perform peer reviews of colleagues work to ensure quality and provide audit evidence. Responsible for production of and maintenance of system documentation Manage own workload split between business project, continuous improvement, incident and problems management and service requests Work with other developers to ensure quality, supervising junior developers as required The ideal candidate will have the following skills, knowledge and expertise; Proven experience in web application development using PHP, MySQL and Apache PHP frameworks e.g. Laravel, Lithium object oriented programming / modular programming Understanding of MVC design patterns and frameworks Working knowledge of .Net Experience of agile methodologies and tools, as well as SDLC best practices Experience of unit testing e.g. PHPUnit Strong working knowledge of front-end development using HTML5 , CSS and JavaScript/JQuery Understanding of version control techniques (Git, Subversion, SourceSafe) Excellent written and verbal communication Full lifecycle experience To review the full list of responsibilities and requirements, please download the job description which can be found on our careers website The call to action: At Assurant, were very big on supporting you to be the best you can be. And from flexible working to healthcare support, from training and development to a range of rewards, what matters to you, matters to us. If youd like to talk about big IT opportunities with the biggest business youve probably never heard of - apply today! 85940

Viventium is seeking an outstanding Web developer with experience in building clide-side web applications to join our development team and play a major role in the design and implementation of its future products. If you master the latest web technologies including Angular, HTML5, CSS3 and modern, modular, testable JavaScript, you’re pragmatic in your approach to problem-solving and highly proficient at writing clean, semantic markup, with the ability to create awesome user experiences for critical business applications, we want you in our team!

You’ll join our development team at our comfortable and spacious office. It’s a fun environment with a team of highly motivated developers working on innovative projects for Viventium. We know how to appreciate good work and will make sure you feel it.

Requirements:
JavaScript, JQuery (At least 5 years)
HTML, CSS, Ajax (At least 5 years)
AngularJS, Angular (Expert)
Advanced knowledge of HTTP protocol, Caching mechanisms and Scalability solutions
Cross-browser/platform compatibility knowledge
Strong knowledge of web security practices
Experience with Test-Driven/Agile development practices. This includes substantial experience with client-side testing frameworks such as Selenium, PhantomJS, Karma, Jasmine, and Protractor, in a continuous integration environment.
Good understanding of Git, source control procedures, and feature branching
Building great UIs that users love and appreciate
Ability to work independently as well as lead a small team of Web developers on various work streams and guide them on development tasks, perform code reviews and ensure design and coding are adhering to architectural standards.
Advantage: Less/SASS, nodejs, Bootstrap, Google Closure, C# (.NET) Development knowledge.

Why Us?
Highly experienced development team
Competitive salary and benefits
Great location and environment (65 Broadway, just next to Wall street).
About Us Viventium is a leading cloud provider of people management solutions. Our agile HCM platform helps deliver an automated and simple experience for HR, payroll, talent, and time and labor management. We're building the most integrated HCM solution that will deliver the best user experience for business managers. Founded in 1992, the company is headquartered in New York City, and employs more than 100 professionals. Viventium has grown into a vanguard solution for enterprise HCM technology. For more information on Viventium please visit our website (www.viventium.com)

Analyst developers at FNZ are all-rounders who analyse required system changes, design databases, write complex financial business logic and create slick web applications. They also work closely with analyst testers and other members of the project team to produce world class software.

Our teams primarily focus on developing real-time transaction processing systems and web applications, delivered through .NET, C# and other technologies.

As part of our talented Software Development function, you will be involved in

Development:
Interpret complex financial business requirements and translate into high-transactional, high-availability, secure and working systems.
Design and build the highly intuitive user interface and interactive financial tools required by financial advisers and investors.
Work closely with our business analysts to design and implement new functionality for our major institutional customers around the world.
Collaborate with other developers to make sure that the solutions developed are robust and in-line with the requirements.
Support new functionality during testing and in production.
Ensure code is designed and built in a reusable manner.
Analysis:
Ensure the solution is well defined and fit-for-purpose. It must meet the requirements and work end-to-end. This will require a solid understanding of the underlying business processes involved in and surrounding the change.
Design / Quality:
Write automated unit tests for any newly created code; and
Perform manual unit testing to ensure any changes made to the system are of a high standard and the system hasn’t regressed.
Collaboration / Communication:
Collaborate with other developers to share knowledge, best practices, useful technology, and opportunities for cross-project system design / solutions.
Successful candidates should have:
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Experience with one or more of the following Microsoft development products (including C#/VB.NET, ASP.NET, MVC and SQL Server), jQuery, Java, CSS. or a willingness to learn new technologies.
Confident, and able to take initiative in a delivery-focused environment.
Independent, self-directing working style.
Ability to learn quickly in a dynamic fast-paced industry.
Enjoy working as part of a high performance team.
Hard-working, innovative and takes pride in their work.
Passionate about creating innovative solutions for customers.
Desirable Experience
Experience with web development.
Familiarity with financial products and markets.
Understanding of web services.
Familiar with code analysis or automated testing tools.
Why should you join the FNZ Journey?
Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world’s largest companies;
Remuneration and career advancement is based on individual contribution and business impact rather than tenure or seniority;
We provide significant financial rewards for high performing individuals; and
We provide global career opportunities for our best employees at any of our offices in the UK, Czech Republic, Australia, New Zealand or China.

*** This role is based in Witney, Oxfordshire. Relocation package available. ***

Audley Travel is an award winning tailor-made Tour Operator with an abundance of accolades to back up this claim. We are consistently recognised at major travel awards for achievements including being in the 2018 Sunday Times 100 Top companies to work for.

As part of Audley’s in-house web team, you will be working on the development of our range of customer-facing websites. You will be involved in a wide variety of projects; from adding new functionality and features to existing websites to complete greenfield projects, ensuring that we always remain ahead of the competition in terms of our online offering. This is a varied role touching the full stack from databases, CMS integration and payment processing right through to front end UI programming in JavaScript and HTML5.

Main responsibilities:

Planning & Programming
Actively engage in discussions and put forward ideas for improving back-end systems, adding new functionality to the customer facing websites and constantly be looking for ways to improve our online offering according to the needs of the business and our clients.
Provide technical feedback and advice on project specifications and designs.
Produce tidy, standards compliant and well documented code in line with our agreed best practices.
Work with the other members of the web development team to ensure code and design consistency.
Project execution
Deliver projects based on the agreed scope / specification and within an agreed timescale.
Document new systems or processes developed and ensure this is communicated to all relevant parties.
Ensure new developments are tested and meet agreed requirements.
Ensure developments are deployed efficiently with minimal impact to the business.
Teamwork and communication
Help the web development manager mentor and improve junior members of the team alongside your own project work.
Share your knowledge, techniques and findings with the rest of the web development team.
Liaise with other internal technical teams (e.g. IT and JD Developers) as required to ensure system compatibility.
Help the web development manager with code reviews.
Required skills:

ASP.NET (4.0+ C#)
LINQ / Lambda syntax
MVC (Razor)
Entity Framework
SQL Server database design and implementation
CSS / LESS & HTML5
JavaScript & jQuery
Web Services (REST, JSON, ASP.NET Web API)
Version control (preferably Git)
Build process & deployment management (Continuous Integration, Team City, MSBuild, Task Runners such as Grunt or Gulp, etc.)
IIS configuration
Cross-device coding / responsive design
Competitors: Trailfinders, Flight Centre Travel Group, Discover the World

Job Description:
About the Team

Working in a large team of Developers and Consultants with strong skillsets in front and backend web development. This team will be focusing on rewriting and replatforming our UK and international websites.

About the Role

Working across our UK and international eCommerce platforms, you’ll help develop and support systems that handle millions of pounds worth of transactions every day. This will involve everything from developing cutting-edge technology features and practices, to playing a major role in the analysis, design, and development of various high profile projects.

Working in a truly Agile way, you will get to see your work live from day 1 and will get involved with lots of big changes focussing on overhauling the entire website and deploying containerised Microservices apps into the Cloud.

You’ll help provide development support to internal users, as well as offering out-of-hours cover during seasonal events and busy trading periods. You’ll also use your expertise and experience to help us continually improve our processes and working practices, actively enabling the department to become as efficient and effective as it can be.

There are flexible working options available for this role.

You know Next, but did you know we’re a FTSE-100 retail company employing over 43,000 people across the UK and Ireland. Wargaming UK


Does the challenge of creating an exciting AAA Free to Play game at a new studio excite you? Here at Wargaming UK you have the chance to join a new creative project at the early stages of game development. You can leave your mark on the game and be part of creating something truly unique.

We are self-publishing our own title, and are fully funded by Wargaming.net, one of the biggest publishers of FTP games in the world. Our studio leadership are industry veterans, and we believe we're building a great studio culture in the best studio space in Guildford. If you think you have the talent to join a world class team, we'd love you to come and look at our studio.

Job Overview


The role will involve both providing a web interface to the development team and working on player facing UI on web and mobile.

Reports To


This position is based in Guildford, UK and reports to the Technical Director.

What will you do?
Design and implement the web interfaces for internal tooling.
Design and implement the web store for the game
Design and implement the mobile experience
Research new UI solutions
Work with the UX department
Develop comprehensive application testing procedures
What are we looking for?
3+ years experience in web development
Experience with HTML/CSS/JS
Experience with multiple modern web frameworks
What additional skills will help you stand out?
Experience with UE4
Experience in the games industry
About Wargaming


Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Delivering legendary games since 1998, Wargaming has grown to become one of the leaders in the free-to-play MMO gaming industry with 4500+ employees and more than 20 offices globally. Over 200 million players enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms, including the massively popular World of Tanks and World of Warships.

Working in our company means always having interesting challenges and gaining valuable experience while working with top-class experts.

Take your place among our passionate and experienced team and bring out the best in yourself at Wargaming!

Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data.

Ve Global is a leading technology company with more than 20 offices worldwide. Specialising in programmatic advertising and website optimisation Ve delivers a range of solutions through one platform. These solutions use unique insights to help online businesses successfully drive new traffic to their website, increase conversions onsite and recover lost sales. Ve’s customers are brands and agencies across the globe. Ranging in size and coming from a number of different sectors, they all have one thing in common: the desire to deliver meaningful online experiences to their customers.

At Ve, we’re cultivating a global community that believe in the transformational effects of technology. Our people are innovators. Marketers. Technologists. Creatives. Adaptable to change and agile in an environment that’s fast-paced and ever-changing. Every day, they challenge us to do better and in return, we’re determined to build a culture that acts with integrity and rewards the impact they make.

We are always seeking the next talented individual to join our team. Search our global careers @ https://www.ve.com/careers

Job purpose:

We are looking for a Web Developer to strengthen our front end capabilities, expedite delivery and set best practices across the organisation.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Work with other web developers to choose best technologies and frameworks for our product needs.
Work with other web developers to define web standards and working practices.
Work on one of our key front end deliverables.
Planning and prototyping new applications
Designing the architecture of the components for our applications
Deciding on the best technologies and languages for the project
Meeting designers, developers and project staff for progress updates
Learning and testing new technologies, frameworks and languages
Staying up to date with new trends and advancements in web development
Experience and Qualifications:

Essential:
Proficient at JavaScript; both hand-written and using libraries and frameworks
Experience in using one or more client-side JavaScript frameworks, such as React or Angular
Proficient at CSS, for example, using CSS frameworks and build systems
Proficiency with HTML5
Experience integrating with REST APIs.
Awareness of front end performance factors.
Desired:
Have experience mentoring other web developers
Experience in server-side development experience.
Experience in unit and functional testing on the front end.
Experience with design or design collaboration tools such as Zeplin.
Personal attributes and other requirements:
Be highly driven.
Have good communication skills.
Be able to operate autonomously
Be a strong team player.
To be able to balance high standards and pragmatism.
Fluent in written and spoken English as this is the business language used within Ve Global.
Be proactive, reliable, responsible and accurate with an attention to detail
Able to work under pressure with strong multi-tasking and organisational capabilities
Ability to think logically and execute methodically, a creative solution-finder

Front End Developer



Job description

Summary

We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving Front-End Developer based in London to join the team working on our exciting Machine Learning product. This is a full-time placement with significant opportunities for personal development.

We offer an intellectually stimulating environment, work within an interdisciplinary team and an inclusive culture. We are a high-calibre, mission-driven team building a technology that improves our World.

The Company

causaLens leads causal AI research. Causality is a major step towards developing true AI. Our technology transforms organisations by autonomously discovering valuable insights that optimise business outcomes. Our flagship product, time-series prediction engine, goes beyond both traditional machine learning and AutoML. It has become the industry standard in the financial sector and is increasingly being used in a wide range of industries. causaLens is run by top scientists and engineers, 70% holding a PhD in a quantitative field. For more information visit www.causaLens.com or contact us on info@causaLens.com. Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

causaLens in the News
Best Deeptech Company 2019 - Artificial Intelligence Awards
‘Meet causaLens, a Predictive AI For Hedge Funds, Banks, Tech Companies’ – Yahoo Finance
‘The U.K.’s Most Exciting AI Startups Race To Scale’ - Forbes
‘Auto ML Platform Draws Interest from Discretionary Funds’ - machineByte
‘AllianzGI Taps Virtual Data Scientists amid War for Talent’ - Financial Times
‘Machine Learning Companies to watch in Europe’ - Forbes
‘Best Investment in Deeptech’ award - UK Business Angels Association awards
‘100 Most Disruptive UK Companies’ - Hotwire
‘causaLens Appoints Hedge Fund Veteran and Data Leaders to Advisory Board’ - Newswire
Roles and Responsibilities

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious individuals to develop an automated machine learning platform for time series. You will work as a Front End Engineer in a team of software engineers and scientists. The application stack is composed of Python, Numpy, Scipy, Sklearn, XGBoost, Keras, Django, Celery, Postgres, Redis, Ansible, AWS, GCP, and other technologies.

A degree in Computer Science, or applicable subject area would be preferable. You should have a proven experience programming for front-end development. You should be comfortable and experienced working on software with a team, communicating ideas, and writing code that can be understood by others. You will be required to implement software at a high level of quality and take responsibility for the product and your contributions to it. You will be responsible from investigating, reproducing and resolving defects.

You will be expected to work to and feed into development standards & best practices. Experience with collaboration tools and general programming tools is desirable. You should also have the ability to understand technical and advanced research material and transfer new ideas into code. Benefits
The opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about innovation and making a difference
Competitive remuneration
Share option scheme
Pension scheme
32 days paid holiday allowance (incl. bank holidays)
Equipment you need to get the job done (MacBook Pro etc.)
Good work-life balance
Opportunities for continued learning and self-development, including courses, conferences and book budget
Flexible work-from-home and remote days
Cycle to work scheme
Weekly journal club and knowledge sharing presentations
Regular team outings, pizza Thursdays and annual company retreats
Fruits, snacks and soft drinks in the office
Amazing, smart, fun and inspiring colleagues, always there to support your ideas, growth and enthusiasm
Logistics

Our interview process consists of an intelligence test, interview and an on-site visit. We will do our best to transparently communicate the process with the successful candidates.


Job requirements

Requirements:
Proficient in JavaScript, HMTL/CSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, gulp, webpack
Experience with VueJS or similar frameworks (React, AngularJS)
Experience with Django and Django template engine

Attention to details

Do you see yourself as one of those “out-of-the-box thinkers”, “Technical masterminds”, “Outstanding creatives”, or “Mind-boggling number crunchers”? If so, we want to welcome you to the Betway family and celebrate what makes you unique!

As a Software Developer in the Compliance Team, you will be involved in the design and development of innovative solutions, where every commit has an effect across the organisation and millions of our customers around the globe.

You will be responsible for:

Taking part in code reviews and collaborative development.

Job Description:
QuantSpark is pioneering the strategic application of data science through the development of complex decision-support software. Our small teams of developers and consultants use complex datasets, build bespoke analytical tools and derive meaningful insights, to tackle strategic problems.

Our teams excel because we are interdisciplinary, creative and focused on providing social and commercial impact. Our work spans both the private and public sector, with clients including the United Nations, FTSE100 companies, high street retailers and Private Equity portfolio companies.

Our recent projects include

● analysing 1bn+ of transactions to help a supermarket decide how to allocate their store space

● developing terrorist content algorithms to enable internet platforms to tackle terrorist propaganda

● creating a location intelligence model to inform social impact communications campaigns

What the role is about:

As a Frontend/UI Developer, you will build websites or applications that our clients use to better understand the data and models we have assembled for them. This means getting to the bottom of what is needed, designing and developing a good solution, and testing and validating that it works as expected.

QuantSpark being a small and smart company, you will be able to bring in your own expertise and ways of doing things, as well as learning a tremendous amount as part of your work, from colleagues and via training. You will also be able to switch between teams and thus work on a range of projects, including pro-bono ones.

You could eventually become a Frontend expert, learn more about automated testing or DevOps, move into Full-Stack development, or get started on Strategic Consulting if that’s where you want to take your career.

Requirements

We welcome applicants who can show technical ability, creativity, good communications, grit and a desire to learn. More specifically for this role, you will need the following skills:

- Strong experience (minimum 2 years) with JavaScript ecosystem, specifically with React.js, Redux, Webpack, HTML, CSS

- Unit testing, TDD

- Code management (Git, Bitbucket)

- A keen eye for good user interface design and user experience.

As a bonus, you would also have:

- Prototyping experience (Sketch/Adobe XD preferable)

- Wireframe experience (e.g. Balsamiq)

- Experience of designing a web app architecture

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Benefits

- £40k to £60k base salary, based on your profile, plus bonuses

- Annual training & conference budget

- 33 days of holiday (including bank holidays)

- Pension contribution scheme

- Cycle to work scheme

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar; Advanced degree preferred
Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging/disruptive technologies
5+ years of programming experience in at least 2 modern programming languages/ frameworks, such as Node.JS, Go Lang, Elixir, or Python
Experience working with HTML/ CSS and a modern frontend JavaScript framework, such as ReactJS, AngularJS, EmberJS or Vue.js
Writing and utilizing RESTful API services and performance tuning large scale applications
Experience with cloud providers (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP), containerisation (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes) and modern architecture patterns (e.g. microservices, reactive architectures, event-driven architectures)
Experience with relational and non-relational data stores (e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB, Cassandra)
Playing an active role in the technology community, ie., contributing to open source projects, speaking at conferences, blogging, etc
First-hand experience with Agile development methodologies
Ability to interact with people at all levels in an organisation
Willing to travel up 50-75% of the time across to clients' sites
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

You’ll work with Digital McKinsey in our London office. Digital McKinsey brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.

As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.

Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will work in small teams in a highly collaborative way, use the latest technologies and enjoy seeing the direct impact from your work.

In teams, you will contribute to the architecture across the technology stack, from database to native apps. You will create rapid prototypes, usually in 2 to 3 weeks, as well as full-scale applications (typically within 2 to 3 months), by working collaboratively and iteratively through design and development to deliver fully function web-based and mobile applications that meet business goals.

Our development teams are small, flexible and employ agile methodologies to quickly provide our consultants with the solutions they need. We combine the latest open source technologies together with traditional Enterprise software products.
Competitors: Boston Consulting Group, Bain & Company, Strategy&

Company Description

The Rank Group is growing rapidly within both our Venues and Digital businesses. If you’re not sure who we are, you may be more familiar with us through our iconic brands; Mecca Bingo and Grosvenor Casino. We have most recently acquired Stride Gaming, which, together with our existing Digital business, forms Rank Interactive. We employ circa 8,000 people globally, with our UK office functions being located in Maidenhead (Head Office), Sheffield (Customer Solutions Hub), London (Digital) and a further office in Gibraltar, which is home to our existing Rank Digital function. We are evolving as a business and are adding some exciting new brands and concepts to our venues and digital offering. By joining an office-based or operational function with us, you’ll instantly be part of a high-performing and inclusive culture, which works closely to support our Customer-facing teams.

Job Description

Rank Group are recruiting for a Front End Developer to join our Personalisation and Optimisation Team in our Maidenhead Office.

As a Front End Developer, you'll be responsible for the technical delivery of optimisation activities, including but not limited to, the technical build and implementation of A/B testing, multivariate testing (MVT), personalisation and content targeting for 'always on' execution.

You'll be a highly skilled Front End Developer and will be able to take a business requirement specification and build the AD/MVT/Personalisation experience to meet business requirements.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Work with the team & stakeholders to devise experiences that are technically feasible and optimal within the boundaries of the technologies available.
Leverage existing tools (Optimizely) inbuilt functionality but also use custom development to meet specific requirements.
Use html, JavaScript, CSS & JQuery framework to manipulate existing content or add in new functionality on site.
Knowledge to build custom experiences across desktop, mobile, responsive and adaptive environments.
Drive regular communication with peers of all key departments and club teams to ensure optimal awareness of digital personalisation / optimisation initiatives.
Work with offshore resources to effectively test and QA experiences, ensuring they work for the end customer as per the requirements.
Qualifications
BS/BA in IT, digital or similar field
Extensive experience of advanced front end development.
Highly skilled and experienced in Javascript, HTML, CSS & JQuery framework
Strong capability or understanding in AB testing and Personalisation tools such as Adobe Target, Optimizely, Monetate
Proficient with use of on-line digital data (i.e. Adobe Analytics, Tealium, data layer)
Pragmatic decision making skills, with the ability to make clear judgments based on a range of factors, e.g. commercials, risk, and customer experience; determine the implications and make recommendations as needed
Proven ability to build strong relationships across diverse stakeholder groups, influencing teams without direct leadership authority
Additional Information

Job Overview

A Bit About Us


At AO, we’re in the business of better tomorrows for our customers, and we do whatever it takes to make sure they’re the happiest they can be. We may sell everything from washing machines to PlayStations, but putting smiles on our customers’ faces is at the heart of everything we do.

We think that in order for you to do your best, we need to support your other commitments. This means working in a way that offers you flexibility, whilst getting the job done. Feel free to have a chat with us about our flexible ways of working.

We’re big believers in making sure every job is done properly, which is why we do everything the AO way. Our award-winning teams work their magic behind the scenes to make sure every customer’s experience is totally effortless. We do our bit for the environment too, with our very own recycling plant to make sure we’re as green as we look. We’re always looking for ways to make our customers as happy as can be, wherever possible.

More About the Role


As a Developer you will help take the lead in managing the software development process from specification to development, testing and stakeholder sign-off to deployment, working with JavaScript (ES6) /JQuery/ Bootstrap on the Front-end with the view to pick up more work on the back-end as you grow into the role (PHP, JavaScript and MySQL based stack.) We work in a technology-driven environment and you will have the chance to work with senior leadership and exert a great deal of influence on the technical future.

Cultural fit, discipline, helpfulness, approachability, openness, positivity and technical interest is what we are looking for. The candidate will have a passion for development and will want to grow in this area. You will be given the opportunity to add your uniqueness to the collective as we work together to solve problems. We want to enjoy what we do and we see no reason why this shouldn't be the case when we have a talented team that pulls together.

Here's What You Can Expect to be Doing


AO Mobile operates in a fast paced, highly competitive market and this role is pivotal to the company succeeding in its ambition to be the leading online mobile phone retailer in the UK.

We are looking for developers with experience in web-based technology and development of front-end systems, with eagerness to learn and develop the back end (PHP)

We prefer close collaboration, so you need to be a great communicator and have solid interpersonal skills. Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products is key.

AND Introduction

AND Digital is a fast growing, tech consultancy AND we are expanding to Halifax.

At AND, we accelerate the development of digital capabilities. In practice, that means helping ambitious leaders and organisations build the teams, products, processes and even operational structures they need to close the digital skills gap within their organisation today, so that they thrive tomorrow.

Clients rely on our experience, agility and craft skills across tech and business strategy, software development and product management to address some of the toughest challenges facing their businesses.

We bring aboard thinkers, tinkerers, passionate software craftspeople and inspiring technologists to help us solve these challenges. Together, we’re united by a sense of pragmatism, purpose and a deeply-held belief that digital products and technology alone won’t transform a business or save the world: it’s the people that count.

About you:
As a Front-end Developer, you champion software quality and technical vision. As a result, you will need to be able to:
Work on large-scale, multiple industries, eCommerce and enterprise-level software development projects using languages and technologies such as JavaScript, Node, React, HTML/CSS and more
Champion TDD/BDD Software development
Facilitate problem solving and work as a team to make them a reality
Work in a collaborative environment where your ideas and opinions are valued and respected
Work with Junior and Mid Developers in your team and assist with their mentoring and career development plans
Be responsible for your own career development - with many different paths to choose at AND you will have the full support of the wider management team to progress your career at your own pac
Joining AND

From the work we deliver, to the way we serve and support our people, we work hard to ensure that there’s nowhere quite like AND. But joining a company is a two-way street: the fit has to work on both sides. So before you apply, here’s three key things to understand about us:
We’re built for people - like, real humans. Not ‘resources’ or ‘staff’. That means happiness and wellbeing really do matter to us, and we hate unnecessary hierarchy and bureaucracy.
There’s no well-trodden path ahead: AND is growing fast and forging a new trail. That’s exciting, and gives us all the autonomy and opportunity we love - but bear in mind it also demands focus, patience and resilience.
Diversity is a priority. After all, to build great products that a wide variety of different people love to use, we need a wide variety of people to help us build them. So diversity is more than a policy or a word: it’s business critical for us.
Still sound good? Great! Fill out the short application form below and we’ll be in touch.

Requirements:

PAREXEL Informatics is one of the industrys leading solution providers and we help customers accelerate the drug development process through innovation. Our product portfolio is built on leading-edge technology and is combined with extensive medical and clinical expertise. As the technology business unit of PAREXEL International Corporation, we're able to leverage our massive investment in technology with our parent company's wealth of hands-on clinical expertise.

This role is based in our new modern state of the art office in Nottingham city centre which has excellent transport links and has a great working environment and the feel of an innovative technology company.

Job Description:
We are seeking a web front-end development expert who is able to re-enforce the skills of the development teams and have a significantly positive effect on the capacity, velocity and flow of the UX team and other teams work on UI aspects of applications.

Main areas of work will be in helping build a modern, responsive, branded UI component library based on clear coding standards (from Bootstrap 4, HTML5, CSS3, etc.) for Parexel to use across multiple applications and the creation of UI screens for other teams to complete functional implementation of.

As a member of the User Experience team the UI/UX Developer is expected to deliver usable, useful, and desirable user experiences. The ideal candidate must be collaborative and have the willingness to learn new technologies.

The UI/UX Developer's responsibilities include designing and developing prototypes from the latest technologies (HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript), developing code widgets for reuse, and solving UI code issues.

Key Responsibilities
Collaboration
Work closely with product management, UI designers, front-end engineers, and stakeholders to drive iterative UI design and prototyping.
Promote, Support, and Maintain
Ensure user interface designs are consistent and intuitive across our products. Support product pre-sales work with the creation of wireframes and HTML prototypes.
Evaluate Products
Assist in the evaluation products in terms of usability, visual design, and navigation structure.
Implementation and guidance
Assist in front-end implementation and provide any necessary guidance to engineering groups.

Qualifications
Skills
Proven skills, abilities and experience in:
Web Interface design taking on board usability and accessibility requirements to a high standard
Building adaptive web interfaces that work equally well on mobile devices as on modern browsers
Working with and building UI wireframes based on UX requirements and Persona based designs/insights
Working within a fast moving agile development environment
Strong ability to successfully organize, prioritize and manage multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment.
Demonstrates the ability to work effectively across organizational boundaries with the ability to prioritize and execute.
Ability to hand code HTML and CSS
Experience with front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript libraries.
Must have strong verbal communication skills
Proficient with diverse writing, presentation, project management software.
Knowledge and Experience:
Knowledge and practice of user experience best practices.
Knowledge of the latest mobile web development, applications, and adaptive mobile websites.
Strong facilitation, brainstorming and collaboration skills with strong user experience orientation and exceptional people skills.
Specific Technology skills and experience in:
HTML including HTML5
CSS3
Use of CSS pre-processors specifically Sass
Bootstrap 4
Any skills in the following a bonus but not required:
Angular (i.e. Angular 2 upwards) using Typescript
Front-end testing automation tools including Jasmine, Karma, Protractor and (optionally) Webdriver (Selenium)
Packaging of UI components using Bower, NPM etc.
Build tools such as Angular-CLI, Webpack, Gulp, Grunt, TSLint etc.
In return we will be able to offer you a structured career pathway and development within the role including awareness and understanding of the industry. Your hard work will be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package including 25 days holiday per year, pension scheme, life assurance, long term disability insurance, a health cash plan and other leading edge benefits that you would expect with a company of this type.

Apply today to begin your journey!

THE ROLE
The role will be part of our engineering team which is responsible for the further development of our digital marketplaces and SaaS solutions. We have an exciting technology roadmap to evolve our architectural landscape to a micro-service architecture in the Azure Cloud to support the pace and scale of our business.
For more senior roles the right candidate will have an in-depth understanding of C# and .NET Core development and deployment best practice and will relish the opportunity to coach and mentor other members of the team. Experience of ecommerce or gaming platforms is advantageous, as is a passion for coding and active involvement in the engineering community.
THE TECH STACK
.NET Framework, .NET Core, C#, HTML5/CSS3, Javascript, React, SignalR, ASP.NET MVC, SQL Server, MySQL, Redis, AWS, Azure, RDS, Cosmos DB, Docker, Git, VSTS, Octopus
KEY SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
• At least 12 months full stack development experience with .NET and Javascript
• Good knowledge and experience of unit testing
• Knowledge and experience of developing REST web services and APIs
• Knowledge and experience of TDD, BDD and test automation
• Knowledge and experience of database development, both relational and NoSQL
• Desirable to have knowledge and experience of developing for Azure services
• Desirable to have some knowledge and experience of search engines such as Azure Search and Elasticsearch
• Desirable to have some knowledge and experience of mobile app development
• Knowledge and experience of deploying to cloud services, such as AWS and Azure
• Some knowledge and experience of CI pipelines and DevOps methods
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES (all roles)
• Active involvement in the development of the marketplace and SaaS platforms
• Active involvement in the development of internal and public facing APIs
• Work collaboratively in a team of agile engineers
• Help foster an agile engineering culture
• Adopt good engineering patterns and practices
• Collaborate with product managers and internal business stakeholders to define requirements and plans
• Compile and maintain good quality architectural and systems documentation
• Work collaboratively with external development partners to ensure code quality is maintained
• Technical due diligence of third-party integrations
• Provide developer support to the DevOps and Customer Services teams
• Keep abreast of the latest developments in technology (particularly relating to ecommerce, microservices and machine learning)
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES (senior and leadership roles)
• Lead the design and development of platform components and APIs
• Provide technical leadership and direction
• Own the delivery of software, including estimation, planning and release management
• Lead, mentor and inspire a team of agile engineers, which may include line management responsibilities
• Define and implement good engineering patterns and practices
• Collaborate with the architects to define cross-platform solutions
• Define the technical roadmap in collaboration with the CTO, architects and other engineering leads
• Architecture and design governance in collaboration with architects and other engineering leads

About Us

Fuse Universal is unique: A next-generation, mobile-first solution that has turned Learning & Development on its head. By putting business outcomes front and centre stage, Fuse lets companies build a culture of continuous learning that delivers measurable business results.

A rapidly-expanding list of over 150 progressive global companies are reaping the benefits of the Fuse approach, including Merck, Spotify, Vodafone, Cancer Research UK and many others. We are creating a culture for more than 140 employees that is friendly, open, energetic and innovative.

Apart from our successful commercial business, Fuse Universal is immensely proud of FuseSchool, its global open education charity. The mission is simple: FuseSchool is dedicated to bringing top-quality education to everyone, everywhere in the world, all for free.

This is a great opportunity for you to join our mission and help us to create the next generation of education systems for everyone.

The Role

We're looking for a talented back-end Ruby on Rails or similar developer to work in a hyper collaborative and creative environment. You'll be a key member of the team developing our main product, the Fuse platform. Our product is already reshaping an industry, and with your help we'll move it into a market leading position.

Fuse's core values are collaboration and taking initiative; we're not looking for a someone to just write code, we're looking for someone to be part of the conversation. To bring their brains, passion and creativity to the table to help us figure out the smartest, fastest way to forge an omni-platform learning solution to delight our end users and clients.

If you are a passionate software engineer, and think you have the skills, drive and talent to help us to build up our team, we'd really like you to come join the team!

Responsibilities
Together with your team, you will deliver quality features and functionality to end-users.
You will test and document the functionality that you are delivering.
You will use your skills and experience to help drive and influence the technical direction of the core team.
You will work in an organisation that encourages innovation and is striving to deliver that to our end users.
You will be working in an environment that cares about you and supports your personal growth and success.
Requirements

Languages: At least one of: Ruby, Python, PHP, JavaScript / Node.js or Elixir

We are currently making use of Ruby and JavaScript

Frameworks: Rails, Phoenix, Laravel, Express, Angular or React.js

We are currently making use of Rails, React.js and Backbone.js

Skills & Tools:

Test Driven Development: RSpec, Mocha; Behaviour Driven Development: Cucumber, Capybara; Git

Databases: SQL (MySQL and PostgreSQL), Elasticsearch or other search engine

Infrastructure: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Jenkins, Kubernetes

Soft Skills:

Proactive, Communicative, Questioning culture, Committed team-player, Driven by results & value

Accountable, Assertive, Experiment with controlled risk, Quick learner

Overview


Founded in 2011 with the vision of using data visualization to solve the challenge of Enterprise IT complexity, SquaredUp is a rapidly growing UK based software product company. We are self-funded and cash generative, with great products and ambitious plans. Our engineering team is all based in UK, in a modern open plan office.

About the Role


We are looking for a highly creative and energetic Full-Stack Developer to join our engineering team focused on developing a new SaaS product and platform that will become our flagship offering over time. We want a talented individual who can bring new ideas and deliver awesome code.

The role requires a developer who has previously worked on commercial, user facing web applications, and ideally (although not essential!) experience with a cloud hosted/SaaS offering. The role involves helping us to develop a new SaaS product from the ground up using the latest best practices, while also leveraging our existing front-end data visualisation technology. The teams working on each feature are tight knit, so there is a lot of meaningful collaboration between engineers, product managers and designers.

Your role will be to build engaging user experiences within our web application, primarily focused on data visualisation and status reporting. You'll also get hands on building out our API-driven, Serverless architecture with code that is well tested and documented. We are keen on building flexible, reusable microservices with the goal that this becomes the platform against which all our engineers will ultimately develop.

While we serve a global customer base, with the US being our primary market, this position is based at our head office in Maidenhead where our engineering teams are based, working UK office hours.

About you

Essential:


You have an in-depth understanding of SOLID and DRY principles
Excellent problem-solving skills
You are passionate about code quality and have experience with a test automation framework
You understand software design and can actively participate in technical discussions
You have an insatiable appetite for continuous improvement and problem solving
An excellent communicator, fun to work with and enjoys being part of a vocal, passionate team
Solid and demonstrable experience developing with JavaScript and HTML5
An eye for UI detail and usability, with an ability to craft fantastic UI elements
Desirable:


Have worked with RESTful APIs and Microservices
Some experience developing a SaaS product that has operated at reasonable scale, preferably in AWS
Experience writing JavaScript server applications with Node.js
Experience with Serverless services, preferably in AWS (e.g. Lambda, DynamoDB)
Knowledge or experience of AWS and/or Azure and their programmatic access APIs
Experience of application performance monitoring and/or infrastructure monitoring
Passion for data visualisation
Key responsibilities
Participate in our product development from ideation to deployment and beyond
Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch ground-breaking new features
Take part in technology and architecture discussions, advocate for engineering best practices (CI/CD, testing, operational efficiency etc.)
Work with the UX team to make our product smarter and more intuitive to use
Maintain quality and ensure the responsiveness of applications
Support continuous testing efforts through test automation
Work with the broader engineering team to ensure that the SaaS product becomes a platform against which all teams can develop
What's in it for you:
Great culture: We put culture first and believe in creating a great environment where people are happy to come to work every day
Stunning office: Picture yourself in our brand-new, state-of-the-art office
Edge technology: Use the latest tools & practices in every area of the business to work fast and smart
Gadgets galore: Fancy a sit-stand desk? Want to try out an Oculus Rift or Microsoft HoloLens? Look no further
Competitive salaries: If you have talent in abundance, we have the packages to match
Choice of hardware: Choose the laptop (e.g. Windows/Mac) that makes you most productive
Smart colleagues: Be part of a great team, working with talented, like-minded peers
Take a break: Eat some free snacks or a great coffee and relax with a game of table-football or ping-pong
Social: From tech meetups to roller coasters, from poker to board games, from Star Wars to cocktails, there's always tons going on
Diversity matters. We're building an inclusive place to work where everyone feels they belong. SquaredUp doesn't discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic including race, religion or belief, gender, age, sexual orientation, marital status, or disability.

We want to give everyone the opportunity to showcase their best selves during the interview process and beyond. Do let us know if there are any adjustments you would like to make to ensure it's more inclusive we're more than happy to adapt and accommodate where possible.

Job Introduction

Our dynamic and forward-thinking Systems Development Team have an exciting opportunity to join them as a Web Sitecore Software Developer.

Systems Development is a fast paced and constantly evolving environment that delivers significant change for The Society. This change greatly improves our customers’ experiences and ensures that our colleagues can work in the most efficient and productive manner possible.

We are seeking someone who possesses a wealth of experience as an accomplished Web Sitecore Developer in their own right; but also, someone who will be self-motivated, driven, has a genuine interest in innovative technologies and who is looking to make a real difference in our organisation.

Main Responsibilities

The purpose of this role is to deliver software solutions for systems used both internally within the Society, but most prominently externally by our customers. You will collaborate with other members of the team to deliver large and small scale change alike with the ultimate aim of providing an outstanding customer experience.

You will produce and develop effective solutions that align to our robust processes and lead best practice and standards around CMS implementations. However, we’ll expect you to use your wider knowledge and experience in Software engineering to influence and challenge the team and utilise external sources to drive continuous improvements and procedural innovation.

You’ll drive unit testing and ensure appropriate guidance is cascaded to Testing colleagues, making thorough evaluations to facilitate defect management across the entire software delivery lifecycle.

We’re looking for someone who really understands our customers and stakeholders and who will be progressive to meet and exceed their needs and expectations. We’ll expect you to take ownership of tasks, show commitment through to completion, and demonstrate the ability to effectively manage your time to maximise value for yourself and others. Working as part of a vibrant team, you’ll be responsible for helping drive the Society forward in the ever-evolving technology arena.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in and be able to demonstrate expertise in the following areas:

Sitecore 8 onwards
C#
.Net Framework 1.1 onwards
Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 and Team Foundation Server
HTML4/5
MVC 4+
Javascript
JavaScript client libraries (JQuery / Knockout etc.)

RESTFul API

SQL Server 2008 onwards

SQL Server Management Studio & Tools

Web Services

WCF

Internet Information Services 7+

LINQ
SOLID design principles

You may also have experience of:
ASP.Net

SiteCore or similar Content management systems

CSS design skills

Having the right attitude is paramount for the role. Having strong communication and problem-solving skills will enable you to support the team to deliver work to the highest standards. Your role will be varied and you will be working on diverse systems and software, therefore having an eye for detail and being flexible in your approach is crucial for success.

About Skipton Building Society

At Skipton Building Society we are not just another Financial Services Institution we are a mutual organisation, which means we are owned by our members and believe in placing them at the heart of everything we do. The same goes for our people. We can only be successful as a business if we have great people and we believe in treating people as individuals. Our values are Trust, Ownership and One Team which reflect the attitudes and way of working everyone here displays on a daily basis, and which are key to the delivery of the outstanding level of personal service we offer our customers.

We’re committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where every colleague has an opportunity to fulfil their career potential. We respect and appreciate the value that our colleagues’ unique differences can bring and offer consideration for anyone seeking a more flexible work-life balance. If you have a need for flexibility then please let us know.

Why Work For Us

We’re committed to paying our people fairly for the role they undertake and provide a wide range of benefits to support our colleagues’ finances and wellbeing, including our Employee Assistance programme, the opportunity to buy extra holidays and shopping discount vouchers
You’ll be able to shape your career within your team and can expect a structured learning and development programme where you’ll be valued recognised and rewarded.

More information on our benefits can be found here

Skipton are an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably skilled or qualified applicants, regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/beliefs, sexual orientation or age
